trans-unit.source: Unmaps a mapped view of a file from the calling process's address space

seg-source.mrk: Unmaps a mapped view of a file from the calling process's address space

target.mrk: Unmaps a mapped view of a file from the calling process's address space

trans-unit.source: A pointer to the base address of the mapped view of a file that is to be unmapped.

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to the base address of the mapped view of a file that is to be unmapped.

target.mrk: A pointer to the base address of the mapped view of a file that is to be unmapped.

trans-unit.source: This value must be identical to the value returned by a previous call to the _WinAPI_MapViewOfFile() function.

seg-source.mrk: This value must be identical to the value returned by a previous call to the _WinAPI_MapViewOfFile() function.

target.mrk: This value must be identical to the value returned by a previous call to the _WinAPI_MapViewOfFile() function.

trans-unit.source: Unmapping a mapped view of a file invalidates the range occupied by the view in the address space of the process and makes the range available for other allocations.

seg-source.mrk: Unmapping a mapped view of a file invalidates the range occupied by the view in the address space of the process and makes the range available for other allocations.

target.mrk: Unmapping a mapped view of a file invalidates the range occupied by the view in the address space of the process and makes the range available for other allocations.

trans-unit.source: It removes the working set entry for each unmapped virtual page that was part of the working set of the process and reduces the working set size of the process.

seg-source.mrk: It removes the working set entry for each unmapped virtual page that was part of the working set of the process and reduces the working set size of the process.

target.mrk: It removes the working set entry for each unmapped virtual page that was part of the working set of the process and reduces the working set size of the process.

trans-unit.source: It also decrements the share count of the corresponding physical page.

seg-source.mrk: It also decrements the share count of the corresponding physical page.

target.mrk: It also decrements the share count of the corresponding physical page.

trans-unit.source: Although an application may close the file handle used to create a file mapping object,

seg-source.mrk: Although an application may close the file handle used to create a file mapping object,

target.mrk: Although an application may close the file handle used to create a file mapping object,

trans-unit.source: the system holds the corresponding file open until the last view of the file is unmapped.

seg-source.mrk: the system holds the corresponding file open until the last view of the file is unmapped.

target.mrk: the system holds the corresponding file open until the last view of the file is unmapped.

trans-unit.source: Files for which the last view has not yet been unmapped are held open with no sharing restrictions.

seg-source.mrk: Files for which the last view has not yet been unmapped are held open with no sharing restrictions.

target.mrk: Files for which the last view has not yet been unmapped are held open with no sharing restrictions.

trans-unit.source: To minimize the risk of data loss in the event of a power failure or a system crash,

seg-source.mrk: To minimize the risk of data loss in the event of a power failure or a system crash,

target.mrk: To minimize the risk of data loss in the event of a power failure or a system crash,

trans-unit.source: you should explicitly flush modified pages using the _WinAPI_FlushViewOfFile() function.

seg-source.mrk: you should explicitly flush modified pages using the _WinAPI_FlushViewOfFile() function.

target.mrk: you should explicitly flush modified pages using the _WinAPI_FlushViewOfFile() function.
